required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trial Comparing Iron Supplementation Versus Routine Iron Intake in Very Low Birth Weight Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Trial Comparing Iron Supplementation Versus Routine Iron Intake in Very Low Birth Weight Infants

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: In preterm infants with birth weights less than 1500 grams, does iron supplementation with 2mg/kg/day in addition to routine feeding with routine iron-fortified milk (formula or fortified mother's milk), as compared to routine iron fortified milk, increase hematocrit at 36 weeks adjusted postmenstrual age (or at discharge if sooner)?

detailed_description.textblock: Fortified mother's milk or fortified formula is routine practice in neonatal units and is not an intervention.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Hematocrit (Hct) at 36 Wks Post Menstrual Age (PMA)
primary_outcome.description: For infants discharged home prior to 36 wks PMA, the last Hct was used.For infants transferred prior to 36 wks PMA, the Hct at receiving hospital was used if available. A non-parametric rank sum analysis was performed as follows so that infants who died before 36 wks and those transfused could be included in an intention-to-treat analysis.Infants were ranked by death (lowest rank) then by number of transfusions (next lowest ranks). For infants who survived and were not transfused, the 36 wk PMA Hct was used as the primary outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Received Red Cell Transfusions During Intervention Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from study day 1 to 36 week adjusted postmenstrual age or discharge if the infant is discharged sooner
secondary_outcome.description: The numbers below represent the number of participants in each arm that received a transfusion during intervention period.

arm_group.description: daily oral multivitamin providing 2mg/kg of iron

intervention.description: multivitamin that provides 2mg/kg/day of iron given orally to infants when they are tolerating 120 ml/dg/day of preterm formula or fortified breast milk until they reach 36 weeks adjusted postmenstrual age.
daily oral multivitamin without iron until 36 weeks adjusted postmenstrual age

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Birth weight <1500 grams
- Tolerating iron fortified preterm formula or fortified human milk at 120cc/kg/day by 8 weeks of age
- </= 32 weeks adjusted post-menstrual age at the time of enrollment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cyanotic heart disease
- Bowel resection prior to enrollment

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: Children's Memorial Hermann Hospital, Texas Medical Center

group.title: Multivitamin With Iron
group.description: daily oral multivitamin providing 2mg/kg of iron

group.title: Multivitamin With Iron
group.description: daily oral multivitamin providing 2mg/kg of iron

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Infants with birth weight <1500 g who reached 120 ml/kg/day of feedings prior to 32 wks postmenstrual age were eligible.

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.description: number of females and males per group (intervention and control)

outcome.title: Hematocrit (Hct) at 36 Wks Post Menstrual Age (PMA)
outcome.description: For infants discharged home prior to 36 wks PMA, the last Hct was used.For infants transferred prior to 36 wks PMA, the Hct at receiving hospital was used if available. A non-parametric rank sum analysis was performed as follows so that infants who died before 36 wks and those transfused could be included in an intention-to-treat analysis.Infants were ranked by death (lowest rank) then by number of transfusions (next lowest ranks). For infants who survived and were not transfused, the 36 wk PMA Hct was used as the primary outcome.
outcome.population: Sample size was based on a retrospective observational pilot study from the 2008 calendar year. A sample size of 75 per group was chosen to achieve 80% power to detect a difference in Hct of 2 % between groups, assuming a mean Hct of 25.6% in the control group, a standard deviation 4.4%, with alpha level (0.05) using a two-sided two-sample t-test.

group.title: Multivitamin With Iron
group.description: daily oral multivitamin providing 2mg/kg/day of iron

measure.title: Hematocrit (Hct) at 36 Wks Post Menstrual Age (PMA)
measure.description: For infants discharged home prior to 36 wks PMA, the last Hct was used.For infants transferred prior to 36 wks PMA, the Hct at receiving hospital was used if available. A non-parametric rank sum analysis was performed as follows so that infants who died before 36 wks and those transfused could be included in an intention-to-treat analysis.Infants were ranked by death (lowest rank) then by number of transfusions (next lowest ranks). For infants who survived and were not transfused, the 36 wk PMA Hct was used as the primary outcome.
measure.population: Sample size was based on a retrospective observational pilot study from the 2008 calendar year. A sample size of 75 per group was chosen to achieve 80% power to detect a difference in Hct of 2 % between groups, assuming a mean Hct of 25.6% in the control group, a standard deviation 4.4%, with alpha level (0.05) using a two-sided two-sample t-test.

analysis.groups_desc: A non-parametric rank sum analysis was performed as follows so that infants who died before 36 wks and infants who were transfused could be included in an intention-to-treat analysis. Infants were ranked by death (lowest rank) then by number of transfusions (next lowest ranks). For infants who survived and were not transfused, the 36 wks PMA Hct was used as the primary outcome.
analysis.p_value_desc: All infants were analyzed according to their assigned groups.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Received Red Cell Transfusions During Intervention Period
outcome.description: The numbers below represent the number of participants in each arm that received a transfusion during intervention period.
outcome.time_frame: from study day 1 to 36 week adjusted postmenstrual age or discharge if the infant is discharged sooner

group.description: daily oral multivitamin providing 2mg/kg of iron

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Received Red Cell Transfusions During Intervention Period
measure.description: The numbers below represent the number of participants in each arm that received a transfusion during intervention period.

analysis.groups_desc: A non-parametric rank sum analysis was performed as follows so that infants who died before 36 wks and infants who were transfused could be included in an intention-to-treat analysis. Infants were ranked by death (lowest rank) then by number of transfusions (next lowest ranks). For infants who survived and were not transfused, the 36 wks PMA Hct was used as the primary outcome.

group.title: Multivitamin With Iron
group.description: daily oral multivitamin providing 2mg/kg of iron

event.description: The two infants (one in each group) died of Necrotizing Entercolitis which is an illness that occurs in extremely premature infants.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This trial was done in a setting where relatively liberal transfusion guidelines (based on PINT study) are used so difficult to generalize to settings where restrictive transfusion guidelines are used.
